702110f.text:
Westchester Avenue (foreground), north side, from Boynton Avenue (Right) to Wheeler Avenue, showing the second part of a panoramic view of the extensive Watson estate. In the center of the view, among the trees, appears the Watson Mansion, a sumptuous stone edifice. The view shows the land being leveled out for the laying out of thoroughfares and for future real estate development. Several apartment houses and store buildings were later erected on this section of the avenue. The road on the extreme left of the view is the former Watson's Lane, which led past the mansion and up toward West Farms Road. It is now (1939) Wheeler Avenue.

About 1910
702110f.folder: Westchester Avenue & Boynton Avenue, Bronx, NY

702111f.text:
Westchester Avenue (foreground ), north side, from Boynton Avenue (right) to Wheeler Avenue, showing part 2 of a panoramic view of the Watson estate. On the rioh t, in front of which Boynton Avenue was later laid out, is the sumptuous Watson Mansion. The estate is being leveled out for the laving of public thoroughfares and future residential development. The dirt road on the left is the former Watsons Lane, which led up past the mansion toward West Farms Road. It later became Wheeler Avenue. This is mount 2B and shows the same section of the estate seen on mount 2A, taken several months later.
About 19l0
702111f.folder: Westchester Avenue & Boynton Avenue, Bronx, NY

700559f-a.text:
Boynton Ave., east side, between Westchester Ave. and East 172nd Street, showing the Watson Mansion on the William Watson estate. The G.W. Bromley map of 1913 ahows the mansion no longer to be there and its site to be occupied (1927,map) by 2-story brick dwellings.
1911.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
700559f-a.folder: Boyton Avenue & Westchester Avenue, Bronx, NY

700558f-a.text:
1204 to 1226 Boynton Ave. (from fore to background), at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Westchester Ave. Also shown (left) is No. 1537-1539 Westchester Ave., at the N.W. corner of Boynton Ave.
June 1915.
James Suydam.
NN ~DR4G.

702107f-a.text:
Westchester Ave., north side, west from and including Boynton Ave.
About 1915.
James Suydam.
